author: VenJoha
text:
I’ve been using VC for just over a month now, both as buyer and seller. 
As buyer, I had one negative experience where an item was not as described, and as it was my first order I was given free shipping, bit disappointing but item was very good value although damaged. Other items I’ve received have been very good, let’s hope my luck holds
That being said, I’ve mostly bought items that haven’t been too expensive, like kids-wear and home. I’m not comfortable paying loads for designer goods that are second hand, no returns and quality not guaranteed. I’ve seen a few items that are more pricey, but I’ll need to think very carefully before buying. 
As seller, I’ve sold quite a few items and am now an expert seller. Like with buying, I’m not comfortable selling highly priced or special designer items here. The main plus is that they sort out posting for you, very easy and less hassle than say Ebay. But app and uploading is very buggy, and IT structure is atrocious. There is no rhyme or reason in brands selected (for instance why accept Zara Kids if you don’t accept Baby Gap?). The result is that it’s pretty dull with brands and clothing, nothing new unusual or exciting. Wish there was a way to input brands I’m looking for. My experience of customer service has mostly been good. I do feel they discriminate against British sellers, as I see European sellers getting away with selling certain high street brands, but when I try to sell them, or sell an item from a UK brand on the same level, it’s refused. And also they’re less stringent with European sellers when it comes to pictures. The commission is outrageous, especially on something like childrens clothes which don’t go for much anyway. That’s also put me off buying, as I know the sellers get so little, it doesn’t seem fair. 
So overall, good and bad. Worth trying, but be careful and don’t hope for much.
P.S. tip if you’re a new seller: put all your unsigned/non-designer stuff to sell on at the beginning, when they’re more likely to be generous. After that, you can kiss goodbye to trying to sell anything not in their brand list.
title: Could be worse, but buyer beware

author: Mrs Gabeva
text: Another month, another ridiculous disappointment from VC. Just when you start thinking that they have exhausted all options of being unprofessional and outrageous, there is a new surprise from them. This time i had to read their email few times just to be sure that i got it right. I have sold more than 235 items. All of them either not worn or worn very little. When an item is worn a little, although no signs, i always say that has been worn, just because this is the right thing to do. And i also have a rule - before posting an item i always first dry-clean it, no matter worm or unworn. I also post my items at very low prices although they are all high-fashion, but this one is on me, i mean has nothing to do with VC. So what happens. Two days ago i sold a Chanel sweater. Shipped it right away as always. Now i am receiving an email that the item has ... slight odour. Shock. Of course it has, it has been dry cleaned 10 days ago before posting and of course as i use a really a good dry cleaning, they use nice detergent. All 236 items had the same odour. But this time they decide that this is flaw and it has not been mentioned in the description!!! Really?!?! As a result they do not reject the sale but they propose a price reduction of 48 eur (and believe me it is already sold at a very low price. So, yes, of course i will accept it just because i have absolutely no time, desire or interest in dealing with them further. And i guess they keep doing that because they know people just do not feel like dealing with them. So they keep getting away with everything. But how ridiculous is that that they ask for a price reduction just because the item has been dry cleaned? Is it better just to send something that has hung in the closet for an year although it has not been worn?!?! I believe that actually taking it to the dry cleaning before posting it is a nice gesture to the future buyer. But obviously that is not way VC concept is who only pretend to care about their customers - both sellers and buyers, but their actions just prove the opposite. And now, i also feel bad for the buyer because i am not sure what they might think about the so called “odour” as i have no chance to explain to them what is the actual case here. I am already so used to Vc absolute lack of professionalism that i do not even care so much but i have decided that every time something negative happens i will just keep sharing the experience. Might be helpful for some of you. For sure VC do not care but this is upon them. As working against your own reputation usually gets you at the end. Eventually.
title: Another month
